Package Enginegames

Class AdvancedImage

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Image
java.awt.image.BufferedImage
Enginegames.AdvancedImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.RenderedImage, java.awt.image.WritableRenderedImage, java.awt.Transparency, java.lang.Cloneable
public class AdvancedImage
extends java.awt.image.BufferedImage
implements java.lang.Cloneable
An extension of BufferedImages, able to be cloned, having a default positioning when drawn with supporting functions

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  AdvancedImage.ImagePosition
    Enum for how the Image is positioned, when drawn by a supporting class
    static class  AdvancedImage.ImageSizing
    an enum for what to do, if the image doesn't fit the bounds of what it is drawn onto

      public AdvancedImage clone()

      clone in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a fabric new clone. Produced to execute order 66

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Enhanced toString function for AdvancedImages. Calls the toString function of BufferedImages and adds its positioning as well as its sizing to it.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.awt.image.BufferedImage
      Returns:
      stringyfied image information

    • print

      public void print()
      prints out an rgb-mesh of the Image itself. Can be quite useful for debugging (especially when looking for the point, where you lost your meta data)

    • toARGBMesh

      public java.lang.String toARGBMesh()
      creates a String version of the image, containing its ARGB data as hexcode. Hexcode is formatted as 0xAARRGGBB
      Returns:
      a string of the image

    • rotateImageByDegrees

      public static AdvancedImage rotateImageByDegrees​(AdvancedImage img, double angle)
      rotates the image. !!meta data / rgb values on alpha-0 pixels is not getting copied!!
      Parameters:
      img - the image which is gonna be rotated
      angle - the angle it gets rotated by
      Returns:
      a rotated image

      Parameters:
      oldColor - the color which shall be replaced
      newColor - the color it gets replaced with
      Returns:
      an image with the replaced colors
